newsitem.title: USA: NEWS CORP SAYS U.S. ENDS HERITAGE PROBE.
newsitem.headline: NEWS CORP SAYS U.S. ENDS HERITAGE PROBE.

text.p: The antitrust division of the U.S. Justice Department raised no objections to News Corp Ltd's acquisition of Heritage Media Corp, News said Friday.

News Corp said the government informed both companies late Thursday. News said Heritage will hold a special meeting of shareholders on August 11 to formally consider the proposed deal. If approved, the transaction's closing "is expected shortly thereafter," News said.
On July 28, the companies said the Justice Department was considering challenging the $1.35 billion stock-and-debt deal.
Heritage provides in-store marketing products, such as merchandising coupons.
News Corp, a giant media and entertainment company, also operates a business that provides merchandise coupons in newspapers and a smaller business that provides them in stores.

Separately, Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc, said it still expects to complete its proposed acquisition of Heritage's six television stations and 24 radio stations in the first quarter of 1998. That $630 million deal is subject to the completion of the News Corp deal and government approval.
